column5: Are any of the GPS map chips very accurate for Canadian lakes?

I have used the Navionics Canada chip (2006 version) for Lac Seul and Lake of the Woods and have found them to be very helpful and quite accurate. I believe the newer versions are even better, more lakes and better detail. I wouldn't go out on these two bodies of water without it.
I have the freedom Maps F40T which is a Manitoba-Part of Ontario chip. Its a great TOPO map with lots of details.. No depths tho.
Garmin/Mapsources's TOPO chip for Ontario is accurate. My experience is limited to one week at a fly-in outpost last Sept.
navionics is the best for Ontario , i have the new est one, been using a gps for about 6 or 7 years on L O W , itis very accurate,
I have Lake Master on my Lowrance... it's amazing for Lake of the Woods... very accurate!
